description: Complex planning task that benefits from decomposition
task: You are a project manager tasked with organizing a company-wide technology conference for 500 attendees. The conference will last 3 days and include keynote speakers, technical workshops, networking events, and a product showcase. Your budget is $150,000 and you have 6 months to plan. Create a comprehensive project plan that breaks this down into manageable phases and key deliverables.
ground_truth:
A comprehensive project plan should include the following phases and key deliverables:

Phase 1: Planning & Foundation (Months 1-2)
- Define conference objectives and target audience
- Establish budget breakdown and secure funding
- Form planning committee with defined roles
- Research and select venue (capacity 500+, 3-day availability)
- Create initial timeline and milestone schedule
- Develop risk management plan

Phase 2: Content & Speakers (Months 2-4)
- Identify and confirm keynote speakers (3-5 speakers)
- Develop call for papers for technical workshops
- Select and coordinate workshop presenters (20-30 sessions)
- Plan product showcase logistics and exhibitor packages
- Design conference agenda and schedule
- Prepare speaker contracts and travel arrangements

Phase 3: Logistics & Operations (Months 3-5)
- Finalize venue contract and layout design
- Arrange catering services for all meals and breaks
- Set up registration system and payment processing
- Plan audio/visual equipment and technical support
- Coordinate transportation and accommodation options
- Design conference materials (badges, programs, signage)
- Arrange security and medical support

Phase 4: Marketing & Registration (Months 2-6)
- Create conference website and branding
- Develop marketing campaign and promotional materials
- Open early bird registration
- Manage social media promotion and email campaigns
- Track registration numbers and adjust capacity as needed
- Send regular updates to registered attendees

Phase 5: Execution & Follow-up (Month 6)
- Final venue walkthrough and setup
- Coordinate speaker and volunteer training
- Manage on-site registration and check-in
- Oversee all conference sessions and events
- Collect feedback and evaluations
- Process final payments and close out contracts
- Prepare post-conference report and recommendations
